Name: Stagnant Dawn on Wastelands
QuestDesc: A pair of constantly shifting spatial coordinates leading to an unknown location has caught your attention. Following the trail, you reach a metropolis... that had been erased long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tethys System recently expanded its frequency feature library and detected a previously unknown, special frequency. In response, the Black Shores dispatched Bloom Bearers to investigate. Valentina informs you that Shorekeeper is now analyzing the abnormal frequency and suggests you meet her for more information.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valentina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Group A, begin data preprocessing. Group B, deploy ground interference neutralizers... Oh, {PlayerName}, you're here.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why is there such a large gathering today?

Dialogues.Speaker: Valentina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores recovered the Threnodian's Gem not long ago... I mean, Leviathan's essence. The Tethys System ran a deep analysis and expanded its frequency feature library. This enhancement allows us to detect previously unidentifiable special frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valentina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fortunately, not all these frequencies are Leviathan-related, so there's no immediate risk of Its revival. That said, the closest anomaly is right offshore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valentina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bloom Bearers not assigned to critical duties have been dispatched to investigate. The Shorekeeper is also dedicating part of her computations to tracking it. The Black Shores has classified this as a high-priority operation and is committing additional resources to track and replicate the signal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valentina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. None of us can identify this abnormal frequency, so it might lead to new discoveries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valentina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper is in the Error Cell. You can go there to speak with her.

Chapters.Title: Take the elevator to the lower level of the Error Cell

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inside the Error Cell, Shorekeeper isolates a hidden message embedded in the abnormal frequency from the chaotic data streams—a set of shifting spatial coordinates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This marks the Tethys System's first large-scale expansion of its frequency feature library. We needed to deploy it while it's still under validation. The data stream is immense, and I need more time. However...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Within the chaos, I found a fragmented message.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The source identity is unclear, but we have isolated a set of constantly shifting spatial coordinates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One points to an unknown location. The other... points here, to the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoever left that message knew exactly where to find the Black Shores. And if they do…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. I will send the coordinates to your Terminal. I must remain here to continue isolating and tracing embedded messages in the surrounding frequencies. I entrust this to you, my star.

Chapters.Title: Head to the source of the commotion and figure out what's going on

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After leaving the Error Cell, you encounter Buling, who has also sensed the abnormal frequency. Using her Forte, she helps pinpoint the exact location of the shifting coordinates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is bad, really bad! Just look at my Casket of Fate! It's been rattling nonstop all day! All day! I haven't seen it this jumpy in years!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ms. Buling, we understand your concern. But the Tethys System hasn't completed its analysis yet, and your talisman divination isn't always—Ahem, what I mean is, without proper clearance, we can't initiate a high-level response...

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You trust those wires over me? I dreamed last night of three upside-down houses right outside my window. That's a horrible omen! And I felt Yin energy. That means something living is behind it. It's not an ordinary frequency, okay?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not that we don't trust you, Ms. Buling. It's just... last time, when you dreamed of a black cat dancing ritualistically, it turned out your Casket just had water in it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll begin parallel observation once Tethys completes its full spectrum diagnostics. It's for everyone's safety here in the Black Shores...

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aiya... by the time you're done crunching the data, even the immortals will be too old to—Oh! Boss! Didn't see you there!

Options.PlotLineKey: Didn't expect to run into you here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know, right? Thought I'd come back to do some quick biz... You know, fix up the feng shui, zing up some romance luck for the lonely hearts... But wah, this one is a big, big problem.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The voices won't stop pouring in. Feels like a whole swarm of abnormal frequencies gathering up. And look! My Pendant of Shifting Yao's so hot, I could fry an egg on it!

Options.PlotLineKey: You've sensed that abnormal frequency too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Delicate threads, twisted webs. A deadlock. It's trapped in a formation... It shouldn't even exist in this world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got any leads, Boss? Maybe I can help crack this one too.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually... I've got a pair of shifting spatial coordinates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh really? Show me! I can try to track them down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is that?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Adrian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A city... submerged underwater?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Adrian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... it looks like it's been completely destroyed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The world's flipped. Rivers run backward. The sun and moon fall out of sync. The jade Buddha lowers his gaze—Boss, that is not a good sign.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After Buling pinpoints the location, a strange mirage of a city suddenly materializes over the waters near the Black Shores Archipelago.

Chapters.Title: Travel to the Error Cell through the Beacon
Gather more info inside the Error Cell

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A mysterious spatial rift appears, leading to an unknown Sonoro Sphere. Researchers from the Black Shores quickly assemble a makeshift observation platform nearby. You want to enter the rift, but Buling can't shake a sense of dread.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, {PlayerName}, you're here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Let me give you a quick briefing on what we've learned so far. This spatial rift leads to an unknown Sonoro Sphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some Bloom Bearers attempted to enter for investigation, but... the rift appears to resist all forms of entry and interference.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As far as we know, this spatial rift leads to an unknown Sonoro Sphere. Some Bloom Bearers attempted to enter for investigation, but... the rift appears to resist all forms of entry and interference.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mirage we're seeing is a projection leaking from the Sonoro into reality.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The researcher from earlier said it might have been a real city...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But if that's true, why is it being projected into the rift? And why were its coordinates sent to the Black Shores?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Maybe I should try using the power of separation? I might be able to split the projection from the rift...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Boss! You zoned out again. Still thinking about the creepy rift, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Something about this isn't normal.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequency data sent to the Black Shores, the coordinates pointing to this rift, this Sonoro of a ruined city... It's hard to make sense of the info we have. If only we could enter it ourselves...

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would've been nice, huh? But this thing's got its doors shut tight to outsiders. But you {PlayerName}, you might be different! You're always full of surprises.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, are you sure you want to? I've "seen" it... That's a Death Gate, clear as day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome back, {PlayerName}. Are you here to check on Chisa?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chisa's been moved to a sealed treatment chamber. She's under close observation and receiving phased therapeutic support.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her body's been running under Overclocked strain for quite some time; some of her vitals aren't in great shape. Simply put… she's holding on, but her body is clearly exhausted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That said, we've started identifying some promising treatment paths. Early response looks good. We're not going to get back to full strength overnight, but with a little time, she should recover steadily. Nothing critical at this point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ria
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I'll get back to analyzing her readings! Overall, things are moving in the right direction. Just give us a bit more time, and she'll be alright.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm? I smell something special...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You consider trying to split the mirage from the rift, but before you can act, a hand bursts from the rift and pulls you in. With Buling and Abby's cries fading behind you, you're dragged into the unknown Sonoro Sphere's turbulent depths.

Chapters.Title: Escape from the city in chaos

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You jolt awake at a bus station within a devastated city, the tower you just saw still looming in the distance. People linger around you, sitting or standing as they wait, some even clutching at seemingly invisible objects. They act as if the catastrophe they just experienced never even happened. You try your Terminal to call for help, but the connection is dead. You call out to Abby, but your Tacet Mark remains unresponsive.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Urgh...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby? ...Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The comms are cut... and Abby isn't answering.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That girl... She's not here either. And the hand that pulled me in... It wasn't hers. That one had a wristwatch.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (These people... Why are they tinted with such strange colors?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Judging by the tower's position, I didn't land where I came in. Was it that girl's doing? Or just the nature of this Sonoro?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The chaos just moments ago... and now, everything's back to normal. What changed so fast?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (...No. That's not right.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Something strange is definitely going on here.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I should look around first.)

Chapters.Title: Ask the office worker what happened

Dialogues.Speaker: Office Worker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, hello? What's the matter? Did you come to the wrong bus stop?

Dialogues.Speaker: Office Worker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is this place? This is downtown Honami.

Dialogues.Speaker: Office Worker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Ah, I see. You must be a traveler! This is a nice season for sightseeing, after all... Shame I can't take any time off. It's even my daughter's birthday today...

Dialogues.Speaker: Office Worker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where...? To the office, of course...

Dialogues.Speaker: Office Worker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just thinking about work makes me feel sick. But today's my daughter's birthday, so I've got to finish early. No overtime.

Dialogues.Speaker: Office Worker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today... I just said, it's my daughter's birthday. I need to clock out early and get the cake and...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Office Worker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't it... Isn't it her birthday today...? Then why am I not home...?

Dialogues.Speaker: High School Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hi! Do you need something?

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you think there's something odd going on around here?
Could you tell me more about this city?

Dialogues.Speaker: High School Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O-odd? I'm not sure what you mean… Everything seems normal to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: High School Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Maybe you were... sleepwalking? Everything's fine here. I'm on my way to school... Please don't go saying weird stuff like that!

Dialogues.Speaker: High School Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I see. You're not from around here, are you? This is Honami! It's really nice!

Dialogues.Speaker: High School Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just across the street is the Sakura Pedway. People like to walk their dogs there, or take pictures. And if you turn right up ahead, that's the entrance to Hanakage Underground Street. A great spot to pick up souvenirs.

Dialogues.Speaker: High School Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and I heard there's a new exhibition today. I was thinking... maybe I could buy some flowers for my mom after school. We... had a fight a few days ago. I still haven't found the right moment to say sorry...

Dialogues.Speaker: High School Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think… if I give her flowers, she'll know it's an apology?

Options.PlotLineKey: She'll definitely know that it is.
She's probably waiting to talk to you, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: High School Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You really think so? Thanks! When I get home, I'll—

Dialogues.Speaker: High School Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... Am I... fading? But why? I just want to go home...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cheerful Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi! Hello! Do you need any help?

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you remember what just happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cheerful Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? What just happened...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cheerful Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you mean? We've only just met.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cheerful Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened here? Oh, you mean in Honami?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cheerful Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, you know, everything's really nice here! Honami is so big and busy, a lot livelier than the little town I'm from!

Dialogues.Speaker: Salaryman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How many times do I have to say it? It's not my fault! I already finished my part! So why the hell is it all on me? Hello? Hey!

Dialogues.Speaker: Salaryman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Tch. Kuso!

Dialogues.Speaker: Salaryman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the point anymore...? It's all so damn pointless. Getting paid like a part-timer while doing a full-time load... Getting treated like dirt but still sucking up to bosses and customers. For what? Is this what living is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Salaryman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I came all the way to Honami ten years ago. I was young. Hungry. Full of dreams. Thought I'd build a life here. And now what? So the thirty-year-old me could wake up to this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Salaryman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My life… My time... Does any of it mean anything?
Hello, Passenger. Please keep going straight ahead.
Cross the footbridge, and you'll find some nice supplies waiting just for you. Look out for the red vending machine... Oh, and watch your step when you see a coffee cup tile on the ground.
When you spot an adorable statue and a wooden sign with coffee beans on it, that means you've arrived.
The coffeehouse opens when the subway does. Our Namipon team will be there to take your order. Just look for cute uniforms.

Options.PlotLineKey: …Guess I'll follow these instructions for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (What's that sound?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'll go check it out.)

Chapters.Title: Head to the source of the sound

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (These people are clearly not in their right minds. No point pressing for answers, I'll only get fragments. Best to see for myself. Maybe I can connect the dots.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Is that... a box? Must be the supplies mentioned before.)
Over here! Over here!
Coming! Wait for me...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Are they... both heading to that place?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This place... isn't right.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The people act like everything's normal, but the city itself... It's long been abandoned.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Why can't they see how strange this all is?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (An abandoned city... Could there really be this many people going about their lives?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is that?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These Tacet Discords... Something's wrong with them!
Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... you're the one from before.
This area isn't safe. When the Tacet Discords become crystallized, they become harder to handle... Get down!
The Lament is looping. We need to get out of here first.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said the Lament is "looping"...? So this has happened before?
Yes. It's like a pair of scissors... slicing Honami City into hopeless, broken pieces.
...Just like what you're seeing now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's happening?
They've overlapped from the distortion. Stay close.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As minutes pass, the Lament continues to devastate the city. Tacet Discords run rampant, and the city crumbles around you. With no time to spare, you and the mysterious scissor-wielding girl retreat toward a safe zone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mysterious Capybara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chisa! Over here! Over here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Drop the loot and follow it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next Slice is almost here. I know you have a lot of questions, but hold onto them for now. Just follow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Platya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A mirage from nowhere, a shadow of ruins... Just looking at it sends a chill through me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Platya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, there's something I want to tell you. But... maybe I'm just imagining things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Platya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That city... looks just like my hometown. The one swallowed by the Lament. I sensed a familiar frequency from it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Platya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been away a long time. My memory could be wrong. But when facing the unknown, even the smallest thread might lead somewhere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Platya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it once... really existed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adrian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never seen anything like it. But that city... it's nothing but ruins now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adrian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, do you think it's a projection of the past or the future?

Chapters.Title: Return to that long-ago destroyed city and cut through the obstacles in your way once more...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Steady breathing... No signs of Irideglow crystallization. I can rule out the possibility {Male=he;Female=she}'s one of the Left Behind.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She's the one who came at me when I first dropped into this Sonoro.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (So why did she save me this time? And even...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're injured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm? It's fine. Just scratches. That won't slow me down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My apologies. I just had to be sure you hadn't turned into one of them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The safe house is just ahead. Come with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the safe zone, you and the girl catch your breath. You lean against a wall to steady yourself while she watches you in silence. You meet her gaze, yet her eyes seem to focus just off to the side, leaving you uncertain what she's looking at.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mysterious Capybara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've arrived. The brawl has ended. Breeze slips through the shutters. Coffee stain dries slow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mysterious Capybara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, a Passenger. Welcome aboard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're welcome. Like I said, I'm sure you have a lot of questions. But first, please allow us to introduce ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mysterious Capybara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah Chisa, so formal, as usual. I think {Male=he;Female=she} looks like a good person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Then you can handle the introductions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, Passenger. My name is Namipon, the <ano=Mascot>guardian</ano> of Honami. I'm also the one who showed you the way... Mmm, I can tell you're a good soul.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hello, Namipon. You're a cute one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, new friends knock like a spring breeze... Oh, I mean, I'm happy you find me cute.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, no. I'm not the kind of animal you think I am. I am this city's <ano=Mascot>guardian</ano>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So of course I have a name. It was given by all who live here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And this is Chisa. A strong, mysterious...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An ordinary student.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry again. Things were chaotic when we first met, and I couldn't tell whether or not you were one of the Left Behind... I didn't have time to explain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, I'm sure. You're just another person pulled into this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can I ask how you ended up here?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A rift opened up. A hand came out of it and dragged me in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A hand from a rift? But why didn't that person escape themselves? Why pull you in instead?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What exactly is this place?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before we go any further, I need to know where we really are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You enter a coffeehouse, finally meeting the "mysterious capybara"—Namipon. It proudly declares itself the city's <ano=Mascot>guardian</ano> and, with great enthusiasm, introduces the girl as Chisa, "A strong, mysterious… ordinary student."

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're in Honami. A city that was destroyed decades ago. You'll still see its name on bus stop signs, in street ads, and in local textbooks for kids.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember that tall tower? The one in the center of the city? That was <te href=851064>Neon Tower</te>, Honami's tallest communication facility. I once saw a billboard for a radio show there: "Voices in the Morning, broadcast citywide from Neon Tower."

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But its last broadcast wasn't a morning greeting. It was the Lament. Records show that on the day of the disaster, it came pouring out of Neon Tower, wiping Honami off Solaris entirely... and sealing it inside this Sonoro.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But don't worry. You're safe here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This <ano=Shashou Cafe>coffeehouse</ano> is a safe zone I created using my "clipping" Forte. The location is ideal and the space stable, so I made it our base of operations.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your "clipping" Forte?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything has a structure. And with these, I can see how it all fits together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inside this Sonoro, time and space are brittle. With enough Resonance Energy, I can trace their "threads" and cut through them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's what I did earlier. I cut through the gaps in space to bring you close to the base.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I was in the center of the city right before the Lament hit?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For the past two months, I've lived through countless repeats of the Lament. Time and space keep getting sliced up and rearranged. What you see now—that chaos—is the result.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's like the whole city's trapped in amber. The people here are caught in one moment, reliving the same day over and over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suspect they're no longer truly alive. Just... residual Reverberations. I call them the <te href=851065>Left Behind</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How long has this been going on?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish I knew. Like you, I'm not from here. I was pulled in by the Lament and trapped in this unfamiliar city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By objective measurement, I've been trapped in Honami for two months. But even when I first arrived, this endless loop was already underway.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you've only tracked the last two months. To get the full picture, I'll need to talk to someone who's been here longer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're barking up the wrong capybara, Passenger. It's true I'm the guardian of Honami... but by the time I woke up, the city was already like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right. I asked Namipon before. It doesn't know more about this than us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But here's what we do know: After the Lament, Namipon gained a physical form and a will of its own. And as Honami's mascot, it knows the city like the back of its paw. The layout, the pathways. I believe that makes it a pretty reliable partner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And apparently... it's made itself right at home.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mind if I take a look around?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chisa and Namipon share with you the history of Honami City. Though the Lament reduced it to ruins decades ago, its lingering aftereffects also sealed the city within a Sonoro Sphere. Time here remains frozen around when the Lament struck, trapping the city in a repeating loop of its final moments. The coffeehouse where you now stand is a safe zone Chisa created using her "clipping" Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it? Do you have any questions for me?

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did you choose this coffeehouse as a base?
How can I leave this Sonoro?
I have nothing else to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because of its location. It's well-placed, with passageways on both sides. Ideal for monitoring movement.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I first found it, the inside was a cluttered mess. I spent the last two months clearing it out. It's still far from tidy, but it's good enough for rest and shelter.

Options.PlotLineKey: Has the coffeehouse always had this much stuff in it?
Has it always just been you and Namipon here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, not at first. I brought most of it in myself over the past two months.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't focus on decorations. Durable and low power, that's what mattered. Like that coffee machine over there. It was half broken, but the inner heating pipe still worked. I modified it. Good for a cup of coffee now, at least.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also rearranged the power grid. Added voltage regulator stabilizers. It may be cobbled together... but it's stronger. Should be able to handle a sudden blackout now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Oh, sorry. Rambled on there. You might not be interested in such things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. It's always just been the two of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But there are still... people in the city. I call them the <ano=Human Reverberations>Left Behind</ano>. They don't realize they're already dead. Still go about their lives, heading to school, waiting for buses, replying to messages... But once they begin to notice something's wrong, their consciousness begins to crumble. Seconds later, they're gone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I don't say anything. I pretend they're just ordinary citizens. They never remember me, anyway. Sometimes I help them fix a jammed vending machine or tidy up a messy stall... not for any reason. Just because I'm there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't like watching them disappear like that. It's... unsettling. Like they were never real to begin with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, well...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After I first found this place and began setting it up, I went out to gather supplies. Then, Namipon appeared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It knows the city's layout and transport better than anyone. It helped me a lot. But all I could offer in return were a few cups of coffee and some desserts.

Options.PlotLineKey: Seems like Namipon is easy to please.
Didn't expect Namipon to know so much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's an interesting creature. And...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I think it's even more attached to Honami than I am.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that interests you, talk to it. I'm sure Namipon would be happy to chat. It was practically humming the whole time on its way to pick you up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been looking for an opening. Based on what I've observed, Neon Tower in the center of the city is most likely the key. The frequency there is highly unstable, and it shows the Lament's most severe spatial fracturing. Could be the source... or maybe the endpoint.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I can't get close. The space in Honami is twisted and overlapping. I've tried every method I could think of, but I always end up looping back to the same spot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It wasn't always like this. There used to be someone else. They caught the misaligned pieces, pointed out the right routes. I made sense of it all... because I had another mind with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Now it's just me. And things don't always go the way I want them to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have any other questions?

Options.PlotLineKey: I have nothing else to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why not walk around the coffeehouse and relax a bit? We've still got time before the next Lament hits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, Passenger! You're just in time! Ta-da! Take this, your very own Namipon Badge!

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are you giving this to me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's something special. Since you're new here, it's only right I lend a hand. Whether you're in trouble or just need to rest your feet, come find me anytime, alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what do you say? Want to hear more about this badge?

Chapters.Title: Search the cafe for key items

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An old clock... its hands are still ticking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone I knew left it here. She believed time flowed strangely in this Sonoro. Used timing devices to find a loophole. So I brought it to the base.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone you knew? Was she... also from the outside and got pulled into this Sonoro?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You could say that. I don't know who she is exactly, but she understood this place far better than I do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She suspected the Sonoro doesn't just loop. It also has a different inner time flow than the outside world. To test her theory, she took apart countless clocks and logged everything. Even her wristwatch was...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Her wristwatch?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm? What?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was it covered in moss?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoever pulled me into this Sonoro wore a watch like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Could it have been her? But why? If she reached you, she found a way to contact the outside. So she did figure it out... Then why didn't she leave? She was always careful. Never acted without calculating the odds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unless... she knew that was as far as she could go.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe she brought me here because she knew that's where you are.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said she never acted without weighing the odds. It must've been a calculated decision. I'm here because she figured you'd need some help.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe she couldn't move forward herself. Maybe she got stuck somewhere. But she didn't give up. She kept looking for a breakthrough, and I'm probably part of her plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't have to carry this alone. She might've already seen this coming, and now she's waiting for you to catch up. You're not the only one trying to solve this puzzle.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said she knew a lot. Where is she now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the tower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She once told me she suspected the only way to break this loop and reconnect with the real world was through the Lament's source, Neon Tower. The closer you get, the more spatial fractures you see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And the more dangerous it gets. But she went alone. Left only a message. Said she'd use the Tower to find others to help, and I should wait here.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She never came back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After that, I left our previous base and came here, hoping to find her. I kept trying to reach the Tower... but every time, I failed. At the Lament's edge, space splits apart. You might feel closer, but in truth, you're not.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My "clipping" Forte works like slicing a shelter out of earthquake rubble. Slabs structured just right, just enough to hide in. But that's all it does.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's nothing against the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... I used to be able to open the path to Neon Tower. But...

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During the Lament, my "existence" was torn apart once, so I lost that ability. The Honami you see now looks whole, but inside it's been cut into countless tangled paths like Chisa's kirigami.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Mine would have been better executed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To find the right path again, we have to reconnect with the Tower. And that means—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finding a frequency that shares its source with the Tower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like this! The <te href=851067>Longings</te> from Honami's <ano=Human Reverberations>Left Behind</ano>. They're what woke me up, and they'll guide us to the Tower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Namipon and I have been collecting them for a while. It hasn't been easy. My ability... still isn't where it needs to be. But we've managed to rule out some wrong routes. We're narrowing it down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it's not about ability! You just haven't fully learned to filter out the negative emotions while collecting.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you collect them... with this bottle?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For some reason, these Longings resonate with the Tower, the source of the Lament. Namipon believes they can lead us to the right route faster.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Count me in. The more of us, the faster we can do this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Most people's abilities won't protect them from that level of emotional interference. Having you there might only—

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not about that. She's just afraid you'll hear the voices and get sucked in too!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not afraid. I just think... it's unnecessary.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be the judge of that. She chose to bring me here, and that means she believed I could help. Maybe it's time you believed in a new possibility too, Chisa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Inside the coffeehouse, you notice an old clock. Chisa explains that it once belonged to "someone she knew" who was obsessed with studying the Sonoro's time patterns. As the conversation unfolds, you learn that this person used to wear a moss-covered watch, the very one on the wrist of the hand that pulled you into this place. But you learn she was last heard heading to Honami City's Neon Tower, in search of an escape. She still hasn't returned.

Within Honami City, space is repeatedly sliced apart by the Lament. According to Chisa and Namipon, the only way to navigate this fragmented maze and reach Neon Tower is to rely on the "Longings" of Honami's Left Behind. Namipon produces a bottle filled with these lingering obsessions, explaining they can resonate with the Tower and guide you closer to the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Umm... Hello, Passenger.

Options.PlotLineKey: No rush. You can finish your Rice Dango first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm... f-finished. How considerate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there anything I can help you with, Passenger?

Options.PlotLineKey: I want to learn about this city.
I want to learn about you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, Honami City... It's a good place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I like it here. Flowers drift by the riverside. A tunnel glows with rainbow light. Even though some of it has changed, I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm still... fond of it. It's like every time I open my eyes, I already know what the view will be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I don't remember how I "woke up." One day, I just knew this city like the lines of my paw.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps they created me? All those people in this city, they built things, opened shops, and lived their lives... In the end, all those little pieces came together. And out came me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you think of it that way, maybe I'm just a strange dream they all had together. Or maybe even... a ghost? Hehe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, but don't worry. If I am a ghost, I'm a nice one. After all, the people who once lived in Honami loved it dearly. Whatever they left behind... must be gentle, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? I'm Namipon! A little critter wandering the city, patching things up here and there. I can help you find your way, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know every alley and corner of Honami like the back of my paw. I'll be a good travel buddy. All I ask for is a cup of coffee or a Rice Dango. Well... it's also okay if you don't have anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll still help. Because helping you means helping everyone in Honami.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Say, Passenger... will you bring us a new story? Chisa's been stuck in this loop for two whole months. You're the only change we've seen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why... I feel like you might open a new path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm really looking forward to our journey ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowtie Butler
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, <ano=Master>Goshujin-sama</ano>. Is there anything I can do to make your day brighter?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowtie Butler
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! I manage everything in <ano=Train Conductor>Shashou</ano> Cafe! Would you care for a hot cup of our freshly brewed house special?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowtie Butler
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's because I am a Namipon! We're all the same Namipon you know. Just shaped a little differently by people's wishes. But deep down, we're all one and the same.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowtie Butler
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, how about a hot cup of our freshly brewed house special?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowtie Butler
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here you go! Careful, it's hot. If the sweetness isn't just right, just let me know, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello again, Passenger!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All good here! We've got everything covered. Don't worry about a thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whenever you've got a moment, just drop by. I'll have a fresh cup of coffee waiting for you. And I'll even share my favorite Rice Dango with you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and if you can… bring Chisa too. I miss her. She used to carry me through the streets of Honami. Our walks were always so much fun...

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Passenger, the time we spent together… no matter how many times I think back on it, it always feels special. The kind of memory you want to hug close under your pillow forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still not totally normal. There's some Lament energy hanging around. But thanks to all of you, the people's leftover Longings all drifted up into the sky that night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like tiny stars tucked into colorful bubbles, they blew away with the wind, carried to the edge of the sky where the light is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think they made it to a better place… Back to the ones they loved most. No regrets left behind. Because every story deserves a gentle, wholesome ending.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm good. Really good, mhmm! Just the other day, I made a Rice Dango all by myself! The shape was… well, not good. But it was sweet and yummy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chisa used to make them for me, but now I can do it too. You should try one next time!

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you want to explore the outside world with me, Namipon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aw, an invitation like that really makes me happy... But I can't leave this city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was born because of Honami, and I'll stay here to the very end. This is my home. Even if it means reliving the same loop forever... I'd still be happy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can come back anytime, Passenger. I'll keep the coffee warm and the Rice Dangos soft. This place will always welcome your arrival.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This sofa has seen some years, but somebody's taken good care of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That little dip on the left side. Hmm... kinda looks like a capybara butt.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess Namipon really likes this spot.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The plastic casing's gone a bit yellow. Some scratches here and there, but the drip tray's spotless.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "Espresso" button is too worn to read, but the milk frother knob still looks new. Looks like someone's got a clear taste preference.

Dialogues.Speaker: Radio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Light, upbeat melody*

Dialogues.Speaker: Radio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good afternoon, everyone. You're listening to the city radio, drifting gently beneath the early summer sun. Now for your daily dose of happiness—

Dialogues.Speaker: Radio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A hundred blind picnic baskets have been scattered across the lush lawns of Central Park by City Hall! Each one holds a surprise: maybe a hand-brewed coffee kit paired with a poetry book, or a handcrafted picnic bag for two sweethearts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Radio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A friendly cleaner even let slip that someone found open-air concert tickets tucked in a flowerbed this morning!

Dialogues.Speaker: Radio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meanwhile, the Geiei Gallery Summer Exhibit is in full swing at Hanakage Underground Street. Rare vintage video tapes are on display, inviting you to take a slow stroll through the long river of history.

Dialogues.Speaker: Radio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And don't forget: today's bus stop announcements are hiding snippets of the song "Melody in the Rainbow." The passenger who finds the most will win this month's city tram pass!

Dialogues.Speaker: Radio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep your heart tuned to joy, and may your day in Honami be a beautiful one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Radio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *A soft outro melody plays*

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything here is fresh and carefully selected. We take pride in our produce and proteins, handpicked and prepped each morning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They taste amazing even without any seasoning!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just make sure to cook everything thoroughly to avoid an upset stomach!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, also. Please don't try to cook weird meat. Like... Gulpuffs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A young girl visited my store with her sheep dolls, looking for ingredients for a dish she was making. She asked for Gulpuffs, claiming to have had them before without any issues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I mean, no one in their right mind would think it's a good idea to give a child Gulpuffs to eat... If I ever find her parents, they're in for a helluva lesson on food safety.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been visiting quite often lately. Bet you cook a lot in your free time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? I happen to know a thing or two about cooking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Has Panhua been talking your ear off about proper seasoning techniques? Well, let me give you the real secret to delicious food: preserving the ingredients' natural flavors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take Milky Fish Soup for example. It only requires simple ingredients, but with care and dedication, you'll get incredible results.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fish becomes tender and melt-in-your-mouth, while the soup retains its fresh taste. No need to drown it in seasonings!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In fact, I'm going to bring her a bowl right now and show her how it's done. I'll make her see the difference!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome! We've got a variety of produce here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come again if you need anything. Since it's your first time here, here's fresh treats on the house, all handpicked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for shopping at Mahe's! Your order is ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't have enough credits yet? I'll hold these for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great food, great value! Come take a look!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great food, great value! I've got a wide variety of produce for you to choose from. Hello again. What brings you in today? Or would you like to chat? I'm all ears!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mahe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Do come again if you need anything.

Chapters.Title: Head over to the preparation station and get ready to explore
Follow Namipon to the Honami Commercial District to collect Longings

Dialogues.Speaker: Sales Champ
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, didn't expect to see you again so soon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? You came back real quick this time...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sales Champ
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, hello, hello! I'm your friendly mall guide, a goldstar salesbara! Thanks for waking me up! Thought I'd come here too...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was my... Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sales Champ
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, is this young man injured? Hold on. I've got some meds!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sales champ rustles through its pouch, pulling out some meds. You lay the young man down on the sofa and tend to his wounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sales Champ
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one's the best fast-acting med I've got. Should start working soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sales Champ
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A piece of cake!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just... need a little rest. I'm alright.

Options.PlotLineKey: You cut open space, just like today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I thought you'd be sent straight to this safe house. But my Forte was unstable. You ended up at the bus stop nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I asked Namipon to find you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm, this Namipon is pretty dependable, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, no need to thank me. I'm just happy to meet you, Passenger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sales Champ
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! He's awake! He's awake!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How are you feeling?

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... It's you! You two saved my life... Thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're welcome. It's dangerous outside. You can sleep here tonight. We've got enough food for one more person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks... I have to get home. My grandma's there alone. She must be worried sick.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just focus on recovering first. You can leave once you're back on your feet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I promised her yesterday... I said we'd watch TV together when I got back. I can't leave her waiting there alone—

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. Not yesterday. The day before...? I... I don't know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember the sky was gray when I left the supermarket. It was raining. Then... I haven't seen daylight since.

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The TV had no sound. The phone wouldn't connect. The road outside the window was... I keep trying to go home, every day. But why...

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. No, no. I have to go home! Someone's waiting for me! I—

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...No... Wait. Did I... already...

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... I...I still haven't...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Channeling her Forte, Chisa clips space to pull all of you safely back to Shashou Cafe. Just as it seems the immediate crisis has passed, the young Left Behind man you rescued vanishes before your eyes the moment he remembers the reason why he can never "go home."

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, good evening.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Want to try this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I scavenged it earlier. Some kind of fruit? Not sure if it suits your taste.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ever since Honami fell under the Lament, food here became part of the Remnant Energy. Living things in this Sonoro no longer feel hunger... but to me, that's dangerous in itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I don't want to go numb.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't want to get used to people disappearing into thin air. I don't want to get used to this loop. I have someone to find. Things to do... and a place to return to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You feel the same, right?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yeah, so we will leave here together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our goals align. I don't care how impenetrable the Tower is, I'll cut a way right into it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter how tight this cage is, I'll tear it down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The more Longings we collect, the more leads we have. I trust that day will come.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of leads... do you know when the Fractsidus came to Honami?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus? You mean the ones in red we ran into just now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So that's their name... Sorry, I wasn't familiar with it. It was my first time in that zone. I've mostly explored the port area. Still no confirmed route to the Tower, but at least we've ruled out several dead ends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So there are other normal people in the city... I thought only the Red Cicadas in my hometown liked moving in swarms like that. Didn't expect to find another type like that here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Comparing them to the Red Cicadas might be rude. An invalid analogy too, forget it. Sorry.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus must've been in Honami for at least two months.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And they've been running experiments here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't decipher their methods from their files, but something's clearly wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Space in Honami is already shattered glass. Anything too forceful could make the entire city collapse. These are hardly ideal conditions for experiments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think... they must've discovered something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe a clue about the Tower. Or some secret of the Lament, hidden in this Sonoro. Something so important, they're willing to take the risk of their experimental site crumbling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're not the only ones looking for a way out. They might already be ahead of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our current priority is...

Options.PlotLineKey: Find out what clues are in their basket.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We could start from the Commercial District. That's where I first arrived when I was pulled into this Sonoro. If we're lucky, something's still there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But tonight, we can take it easy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No <te href=851066>Irideglow</te>. No Lament. Just Honami, a quiet city at night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks for sharing this late-night snack with me... even if it's just canned fruit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But still, thank you. See you tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That night, you and Chisa rest on a bench outside the cafe. She confides in you her refusal to grow numb and indifferent to the loop of life and death in the city. Together, you will find a way to tear this cage apart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowtie Butler
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good morning, Goshujin-sama! Did you have a good rest?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowtie Butler
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your breakfast. Please enjoy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sales Champ
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, yes! It's such a nice day today, so Chisa went out scavenging for supplies. We wanted to do our part too... so we started tidying up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowtie Butler
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once we're done, maybe there'll be space for a few new decorations? Hmm... It might be a nice surprise for Chisa! Passenger, do you have any ideas?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm not exactly an expert in interior design...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowtie Butler
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wonderful! This way, if you please!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good morning. I'm back. Want something to eat? I picked up a few snacks from the store. Figured it'd be good to have some variety.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Didn't expect the cafe to be this clean. For a moment, I thought I walked into the wrong place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it looks nice. Really lifts the mood. Thank you, all of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well now, are you ready to go?

Chapters.Title: Head over to the preparation station and get ready to explore
Search for clues in Honami City together with Chisa

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually… after reading Sumika's notes, I noticed something we might have missed.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lament we're experiencing here in Honami... it doesn't feel like the real thing. It's weaker, like the power is fading...

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome back, dear Passengers!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we want real answers, we'll need to reach the Lament's source... inside Neon Tower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you like a cup of Coconut Cheese Latte made by yours truly? It's called Cloudy Coconut Sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the very least, we can now confirm this is tied to the Fractsidus's Controllable Sonoro Project.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello? Heelllloooo?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Ah. Sorry. Didn't mean to ignore you. We got a little distracted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay. I'm used to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, Passenger... there's something I need to tell you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I sensed a frequency that's closely connected to you. It's not from this space, but... it's calling for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it... coming from the outside? Is the connection between this Sonoro and the outside world growing stronger?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Correct. It's beyond Honami City. Mm, part of it resonates from within you, but… it's not your frequency. What could it be?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who's Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... I haven't seen it before.

Options.PlotLineKey: Abby is being blocked by this Sonoro.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it's looking for you, just like Namipon said.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this space should be completely sealed off... unless the restraints around this Sonoro are weakening. Could it be... because of the Longings we gathered?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... If you're in a hurry to meet it, I can try recalibrating Neon Tower's coordinates. But it'll take a little more time. Please wait patiently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seem concerned about this Abby, Passenger.

Options.PlotLineKey: Because Abby is important to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Passenger. I'll do my best.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mhm, I can feel it too. Don't worry. I'll do my best.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So please, get some rest... for those who care about you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you... want to take a breather on the terrace?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay. Whenever you're available.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Back at the cafe, Namipon senses a frequency calling out for you. It's not of this space, but emanating from within you. You realize it must be Abby. Could this mean the restraints around this Sonoro Sphere are beginning to weaken?

Determined, Namipon begins sifting through the collected Longings to chart a route toward Neon Tower. While you wait for the results, Chisa invites you to join her for a breather on the cafe's terrace.

Chapters.Title: Head to the cafe terrace and find Chisa

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nice weather today. Rare to see a sunset like this. If Sumika were here, she'd probably capture this moment in one of her ambers.

Options.PlotLineKey: Looking at it does take a weight off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. To investigate what could possibly cause a sunset so unusual...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See that child by the signpost?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the seventh time I've seen him fall there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The cashier keeps wiping a stain that isn't there... The walls are barely standing, but her uniform is spotless... just like it was.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The vending machine is due for restocking. With soda bottles that are already decades old.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That cat has been lying there for two months... maybe longer. I've only known it for two.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Middle school students are still taking photos of the sky after class, one that is now torn apart by Resonance Cords. But in their eyes, it's still clouds. Birds. Rainbows... the perfect sky of that single day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The store keeps playing pop songs from the last century. The window that never shut all the way is still stuck at the notch it was left on years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've all been left behind in the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for me... I'm starting to forget what day it is today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This kind of life almost feels like...

Options.PlotLineKey: An anime episode that got cut halfway?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Heh. Interesting analogy. When I was little, every summer break was spent with cool fans, watermelons, and an old TV. I loved watching anime and was always curious about those... special worlds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Heh. Interesting analogy. When I was little, I once lost an entire holiday's worth of homework I'd worked really hard on. My parents and teachers didn't scold me, but I still felt terrible about it for a long time... Now I always save my work the second I finish it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think it's kind of like... an unanswered call.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My parents were always busy. Whenever I missed them, I'd try calling... but most of the time, they couldn't answer. Even when they did, we never had much to say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After I became a Resonator and was placed under supervision, those chances became even rarer. I think the things people said about me ended up putting a lot of pressure on them, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In my hometown, Resonators aren't really accepted. Someone who can't control their abilities is like a ticking time bomb... feared and resented.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't want my parents to suffer because of me. So I thought... maybe if I stayed away, they wouldn't have to deal with the looks. Or the whispers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't say we're very close.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's not that I hate them. Things were just... ordinary. They had their jobs, I had school. We hardly spent time together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... sometimes, I do miss them. Just a little.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's why you have to leave here.
You need to get back to keep living your life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I really... really want to end this vicious loop.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've already tried so many times, but the outcome is always the same...

Options.PlotLineKey: But you still haven't stopped trying.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every time the Lament struck, you moved toward Neon Tower, against the tide of fleeing citizens, knowing full well it was the most dangerous place to be.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You knew you couldn't save those who were already "gone," and still, you reached out. To the mother and daughter. To the injured young man. To me, when I first fell into this city.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You knew that in this endless loop, saving someone didn't change a thing. But still, not once did you ignore a cry for help. So...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you appeared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At a time no one should have. In the most dangerous place. Beneath the Lament's shadow. It wasn't luck or coincidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sonoro isn't fully sealed anymore. Sumika cracked it open. And from the moment we met, the loop had already begun to loosen.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which means there's a chance to break it completely. I'm willing to put my faith in you. Let's seize that chance together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why would you...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because we're partners. Isn't it only natural for me to trust you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chisa—! Passenger—!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I just confirmed Neon Tower's coordinates!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You follow Chisa up to the cafe's terrace. The setting sun bathes the ruined city in a warm glow. You both lean against the railing, watching the Irideglow slice and stitch the cityscape in an endless cycle. In this quiet moment, Chisa opens up about her past for the first time.

Chapters.Title: Find Namipon and figure out what's going on

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whew… The way to Neon Tower is in disarray, but lucky us! We've got this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Press this... and that should do it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now we have a route to the Tower's base. Once you're all set, we can move out!

Chapters.Title: Talk to Namipon and leave for Neon Tower

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To the Tower we go! Are you ready, Passenger?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, Ginga Street. A good place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello! Old friend!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know this place well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm. That's right. Those ad walls were once covered with my picture. And over there. Used to be claw and capsule machines... all the prizes were me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... that's why I want to bring them back. I want to bring everyone home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave the collecting to me. But, uh... once we start, the frequency spikes might draw in... things. I'll leave that part to you, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just some old friends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm. Looks like we haven't gathered enough. Maybe we need to find somewhere with more people?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about a bit farther ahead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Follow this road... Mm. This used to be Honami's main shopping street. Always full of life!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During the holidays, you'd see stalls on both sides. Shoppers everywhere. You could find all sorts of treasures… like me. In all kinds of shapes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm? Who's there?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Incoming!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus... How did they get here?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They left behind some kind of... device?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like Frequency Detectors. But it's rough. Like something rushed the night before a lab demo. Even the most basic Frequency Stabilizers are missing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not saying they're completely useless. Just that, performance-wise, it's not very reliable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chisa! Passenger! Come quick! There's a lot of... strong Longings here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's meet up with Namipon first.

Chapters.Title: Head to where Namipon is pointing

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This way! Over here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can start collecting now. Oh, and, um... More troublemakers might show up...

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, collecting in a crowded place really is different! We've got quite the catch. Let me sort them out...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is just my speculation, but something tells me a powerful, hidden force is behind these Tacet Discords, directing them to drive away all... outsiders.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Under what circumstances would you want to drive away outsiders...?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (When you see this place as your own territory... your "home.")

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the matter?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you hear that...?
Help...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Tacet Discords cleared, Namipon excitedly checks the progress of your collected Longings. Chisa, folding away her scissor blades, shares a grim suspicion: a powerful, hidden force is commanding the Tacet Discords, driving them to expel any "existence" that does not belong to Honami City. As you consider this, a faint cry for help suddenly echoes nearby.

Chapters.Title: Enter Meishin Passageway and check the situation

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It hurts...

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help... Please help me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's wounded badly. Not good, already unconscious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we don't get him out, he won't make it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it... the Lament?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Slicing has started.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Space fractures and is rearranged. Everything caught inside, people included... they're all twisted into absurd, broken shapes... until the Lament ends.

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I'll hold the line.
This time, we face it together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The slicing is getting closer. Space will break down any moment now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to get out of here immediately.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chisa?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on to him. And hold onto me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You help a wounded man to his feet, only to realize his condition is critical. As you guide him out, the Lament descends once more. Bizarre Irideglow "slices" through the visible space, creeping steadily closer. With seconds to spare, Chisa raises her scissor blades at the wall before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's direct... Well, efficiency first.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Might as well make use of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here we are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I first ended up in this place two months ago. It wasn't during a Lament occurrence, so I had a bit of time to explore the city.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you still remember what happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Vaguely. But I do recall the first occurrence hit three days later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At that time, Irideglow bled through the cracks in the gray sky, like the world had been sliced open by an invisible pair of scissors. People, buildings, even space itself… everything fell into chaos.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we need to recreate the city as it was before the Lament to uncover what really happened…

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who's there?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem. Sharp as a tack, you two.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you've caught on, the game is afoot. Listen up, young folks! This district is full of secrets!

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been staking out this area for three days, five hours, and... well, a long time! And guess what? I've spotted something really fishy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those red coats sneaking around and tinkering every day... Mark my words, they're up to no good!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Red coats...? Could it be the Fractsidus?

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what do you say? Care to join my Super Detective Team and hunt for the truth?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Super detective team.. and hunt for the truth?

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly! Just follow me. We're two clues away from cracking this wide open!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next day, you go to where Chisa first landed in Honami City two months ago. There, you have an unexpected encounter with the detective capybara, Polmes. It claims to have spotted suspicious activity and asks you to investigate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, well, you seem quite familiar with this place, young lady.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So do you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Naturally. That's basic detective work... Wait, over there! That's it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus must have left this device here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... it's inactive. Something's covering it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Irideglow Crystals. We need to clear them off first.

Chapters.Title: Follow Namipon to the next area
Follow Namipon to the next area

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By Jove! My instincts were right! They are up to something shady!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These should be the Fractsidus's experimental devices.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that a research report?

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh, first time seeing a report like this. "Lament Residue"… could that be those iridescent things we just saw?

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? Why so quiet, all of you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Expand the existing Sonoro Sphere"... Could that really be their goal?
