Options.PlotLineKey: It looks like they failed judging from this report.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...This is absurd.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Sonoro could be controlled, then why... why hasn't this loop been broken? The Left Behind are still trapped in this false memory of peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Controlling it can't be their objective. They're using it. Seeing if each Lament occurence is slower or the deaths more orderly... It's like throwing people into the fire just to test the temperature.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There might be more clues in other test sites.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right! There's another one close by! This way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You uncover a Fractsidus research report shedding light on their actions in Honami City. It all points to the chilling goal of expanding this Sonoro Sphere and ultimately establishing control over it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, I didn't expect you to see through my disguise... Keen eyes like yours make you perfect candidates for my Super Detective Team!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And what exactly does this team do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why, investigate those red-coated troublemakers, of course! But come to think of it, I haven't seen them around lately. Suspicious...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May I ask how many members are on this team now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Just the one capybara.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem! Anyway, we've arrived!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another report. Just as we expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The plot thickens... this one's almost identical to the last report.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Same sequence number... but different data.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So they've been running the same experiment repeatedly, with different results each time.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... why are they both labeled as No. 20?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another report you find bears the exact same sequence number as the previous one, but its recorded data is different. This means the Fractsidus has been conducting the same experiment repeatedly, yet labeling every iteration as "No. 20."

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Nothing. Just thinking about a friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I'm sorry, I forgot to tell you her name. It's Sumika.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is where I first met her, where our old base was. I left after the Lament sliced and stitched this place over and over… and I never returned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, Sumika used to tease me. She'd say I had to map everything out—routes, terrain, vantage points, exits and entrances. All of it. But she… always went with her gut. Terrible sense of direction, though.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even so, she chose to go to that tower alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to go back. To see if there's anything we missed.

Options.PlotLineKey: Sure. We do need more leads.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. For accompanying me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ooo!

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you coming with us, Detective?

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I'm deep in deduction! Still need more clues to uncover what those red-coated rascals are really after.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, your invitation is appreciated, but a good detective never leaves a case unsolved. I still need more clues to uncover what those red-coated rascals are really after.

Dialogues.Speaker: Polmes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll take my leave now. It's been a pleasure working with two sharp tools like you. Until next time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chisa recalls that she and her friend Sumika once made a building here their old base. Believing the old hideout might still hold overlooked clues, you decide to investigate and part ways with Polmes for the time being.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A stash of old science magazines with notes scribbled on a few pages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I found some too. Must've been Sumika's. She used to read here during her downtime.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd be with her. Sometimes we'd read the same thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But most of the time, I'd be maintaining my weapon.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That stash in the corner... they're all clocks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There used to be more. Sumika collected them, placing them all across the city before the Lament struck. Then she went back to retrieve them one by one. It was pure madness... but it proved her theory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The closer you get to Neon Tower, the slower time moves. In other words, all of Honami City might be lagging behind the outside world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember that moss-covered watch? That's what first made Sumika notice something was off about this city.

Chapters.Title: Examine the top of the box

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this a piece of amber?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sumika left it here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her Forte allows her to create amber that stores memories or moments in time.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Memories or moments...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Just hold it like this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …And you'll see what's been preserved inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inside the old base, you discover ambers formed from Sumika's Forte. As you and Chisa connect with them, you see moments Sumika chose to record.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shixifeidu_main_2_8_18002_21

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sumika mentioned the strange flow of time here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She told me that time within this Sonoro moves slower than it does outside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The plants grow like everything's normal, yet those who died remain trapped in this loop. It's like something very powerful is holding them back.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's holding them back might just be their unfulfilled Longings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They awakened Namipon to a city that still needs him.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look. More amber behind us. This piece looks like it was created recently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go on. Hold it like you did before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shixifeidu_main_2_8_18002_22

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Judging from her notes, she really did make it to Neon Tower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to find a way there. The sooner, the better.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's return to the cafe first. We'll need to check with Namipon and see if the Longings we've gathered are enough to guide us to the Tower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shixifeidu_main_2_8_2202_3

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over here! Over here! Yup, right there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The big tall Tower, hiding in the broken city... it's finally opened up for us! Let's gooo!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Coughing)

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Coughing) So much dust!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So much rubble from the city scattered in here... debris and loose junk. Watch your step, everyone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to bypass all this and find a way to get to the top...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Sumika really made it this far, she would have left a sign for me to follow.

Chapters.Title: Examine the statues covered by Irideglow Crystals

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa, this is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus referred to these as Light Irideglow Crystals in their reports. Might be Lament residue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like before, we should be able to clear them out to restore the area.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look! A shiny stone!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's Sumika's amber.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shixifeidu_main_2_8_23001_21

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sumika might have taken this path straight ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sumika said her body was getting colder...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is unusually cold here. There's a strange sensation of warmth being pulled away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yup... my bones are starting to shake!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whatever is causing it, we need to stay sharp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More Irideglow Crystals here!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's clear them off. Sumika's notes might have been buried beneath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is it... Sumika's amber.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Pick up the amber and hold it in your palm)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shixifeidu_main_2_8_23005_17

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She said the path ahead is wrong...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to go back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, wait... w-wait for me... I'm freezing out here... Brrr...

Chapters.Title: Approach the cherry blossom tree inside the tower

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa... look how big! And that tree!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at those chairs.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're covered in Irideglow Crystals too… Sumika's notes must be hidden underneath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sumika... She marked every correct path. That's an amazing deed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sumika
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's... that sound? Am I just... hearing things?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sumika
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are those... people from the Black Shores?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sumika
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! You... Can you see this "entrance"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sumika
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please... help the people here... They're trapped...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sumika
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My friend... she's trapped here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sumika
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sumika
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just once...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sumika
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me win.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahh... what an incredible girl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She got so close to finding the source of the Lament in the city. But as long as someone keeps going where she left off, she wouldn't have regretted it. Not once did she live with regret.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you hear that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Argh... Sounds like the space inside the tower is being sliced up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did we miss it? Is it because the Lament here is different from the one outside?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe, the Tower itself has already been consumed by the Lament and has become a part of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, Namipon. Take my hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A-aachoo! O-okay, Chisa!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aaaaahhhhh—

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From Sumika's amber, you witness her final moments. Barely clinging to life, Sumika reaches a trembling hand toward a rift torn open by the Lament. Her last hope is that someone will find this city, break the tragic loop, and free her friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Space has just been sliced again.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The temperature's dropping, but there's no frost or ice anywhere. Could it mean this "Tower" really is absorbing warmth from human bodies, just like Sumika suspected?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there... I see something.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Test No. 20 again...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who's there?!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These Fractsidus operatives... Looks like they're also among the Left Behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So they've become part of their own experiment... trapped in a loop they can't even recognize.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why they've been repeating Test No. 20.
Obsesssion... Too lighhhht... too lighhhht! Can't suppressss... the forgetting...
No, no... Too heaaaaavy... heaaaavy... heaaavy...
Too much... pain... Nooo... not here...
Must return... Must... GO—!
No, take me back to ████...!
Mom, I think I painted the tree crooked again...
Not at all, sweetheart. It's beautiful—Wait, GET AWAY FROM THE WINDOW!
Oh come on, you're lost again? Wait, what's that...?
RUN! GO BACK! JUST RUN!
Quick, hold my hand... HOLD MY HAND! Don't be scared, don't be scared...
Wrap your arms around my neck! On three... One, two...
No, Daddy! You promised to bring the puppy!
Three! Jump—now!
It's the helicopter again! Hurry! Wave the sheet... No! They didn't see us!
No... there's no time for last words...
It's alright... Daddy will be back when you count to one thousand... Haruka... Don't fall asleep... Stay awake...
Take the last candle...
It's okay... I'll find the way back...
Stay with me... don't go...
Losssst… it hurrrts… but you… you still…
Get ouuuut... of my waaayyyyy...
Let me… go hooome…
Let me… go hooome…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is this—?!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it running to...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …the very heart of the Lament?

Chapters.Title: Pursue the source of the Lament
Continue to the source of the Lament
Eliminate the Tacet Discords blocking the way
Eliminate the Tacet Discords blocking the way
Eliminate the Tacet Discords blocking the way

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chisa...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is she inside that space now?

Options.PlotLineKey: TURN AROUND AND GRAB MY HAND!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shixifeidu_main_2_8_28_7

Chapters.Title: Head to the top of the tower and face ???

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You...
GET… OUT—!
Take your cursed, bloated luxury of time—!
Don't touch our cocoon... Woven for ██ years…
Buried here… is our home…
GET OUT—
GET OUUUUUT——!!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place... it's where I first arrived in Honami.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, Neon Tower was engulfed by the Lament. But now that the warped space has settled… even the wind feels calmer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At last… we've reached the end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Or maybe... this is where it all begins.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wahh! Wh-why didn't you answer me?! I waited outside forever! I had to force my way in to find you! Seriously, I thought you were—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Sonoro was sealed off from the outside world. But it looks like it's reopened now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yup! All thanks to our pals at the Black Shores! They've been working nonstop to install all kinds of devices. And with the connection getting stronger, I finally managed to slip through when the rift popped back up and... Wait...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A new face! Hiya! Is she coming with us?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. We're just about to leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone's still waiting for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Chisa return to the city center, the very place where you first arrived in Honami City. The clouds above Neon Tower have parted, and sunlight bathes the city in a newborn radiance. Abby descends from the sky, landing safely in your arms.

In that moment, you both realize the Sonoro's restraining seal has been broken. Together, you have opened a way for Honami City to connect with the world outside.

Chapters.Title: Re-enter Neon Tower through the portal

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are you out here alone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just… I still can't quite accept it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know they died a long time ago, and they were only Human Reverberations that the Sonoro created. But now they're all... gone.

Options.PlotLineKey: You need time to accept that they're gone.
You need time to accept what's changed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Namipon... even though we were only together for two months, every time I came back to the cafe... it was always there, waiting for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No choice, I have to face it... Let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to your efforts, the Left Behind have finally found their way "home." But with the mission ended and Namipon vanishing, a piercing loneliness overwhelms Chisa. You find her sitting alone on a bench in the park outside the cafe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sunlight through the glass, sugar cubes crackle in sun, the scent of tea drifts—Hey! No snatching, no snatching!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, Passengers! You're back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...What... How are you—?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm? I'm brewing tea for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you said... "this is as far as I go"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... yes. It was as far as I could go because I had to go back to the cafe first...

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It just… took a bit longer to finish that sentence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wh-what's wrong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing... forget it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just... glad you're back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's something I need to finish. But...

Options.PlotLineKey: But before that, you need to handle something personal?
Now can you finally tell me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Always so reserved, Chisa. I'll say it for you, then—

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My Overclocking symptoms are—

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My Overclocking symptoms... they're not fully resolved. Inside this Sonoro, things are stable. But once I leave... I don't know if it'll spiral out of control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still... even if I do Overclock, I wouldn't just attack someone. Sumika once mentioned she had some friends, researchers, who might be able to treat me. But... but I...

Options.PlotLineKey: I happen to know her friends.
Do want to try trusting me now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chisa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to the Black Shores with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To the place where Sumika once lived and worked. To where a new beginning awaits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What I said earlier… wasn't quite right. This is the real ending.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm. So wholesome.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now… it's time to take that step toward a new beginning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Namipon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... that's...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You return to the cafe to find Namipon in a lively tussle with its companions over a plate of snacks—it hadn't disappeared after all!

With one story concluded, a new journey awaits. At your invitation, Chisa agrees to travel with you back to the Black Shores, to see the place where Sumika once lived and worked… and to step into a new beginning.
